snippet: The British oil company said it had been approached by potential buyers for the venture, which has provided steady income but also been a source of conflict with its Russian partners.
abstract: BP plans to sell 50 percent stake in its Russian joint venture TNK-BP after being approached by unidentified potential buyers; deal, which could fetch $30 billion, will end a profitable but contentious decade for the company in Russia.

byline.original: By JULIA WERDIGIER and ANDREW E. KRAMER
byline.contributor: Julia Werdigier reported from London and Andrew E. Kramer from Moscow. Keith Bradsher contributed reporting from Hong Kong.

lead_paragraph: The British oil company said it had been approached by potential buyers for the venture, which has provided steady income but also been a source of conflict with its Russian partners.

headline.seo: BP to Seek Sale of Russian Venture TNK-BP
headline.main: BP to Exit Its Venture in Russia
headline.print_headline: BP to Exit Its Venture In Russia
